channel.title: Ardetus
channel.description:
[center][img]http://ardetus.com/forums/images/icons/house.png[/img] [url=http://ardetus.com]Website[/url] | [img]http://ardetus.com/forums/images/icons/rewards.png[/img] [url=http://ardetus.com/index.php?pageid=rewards]Incentive Rewards[/url] [hr] [img]http://i.imgur.com/5IRKsXO.png[/img] [img]http://ardetus.com/devpics/cloader.png[/img] Keeping the Ardetus client up to date is a simple task. Simply launch the loader and it will automatically check for archive, file, and client updates, and then update them immediately. It will then launch the latest version of the client for you.
[img]http://ardetus.com/devpics/loader1.png[/img] [img]http://ardetus.com/devpics/cloader2.png[/img]
[img]http://ardetus.com/devpics/cmedia.png[/img][spoiler] Every piece of the user interface in this picture is using my component system.
http://i.imgur.com/hRwshe0.png
http://i.imgur.com/49KF5hp.png
http://i.imgur.com/gnPWwK9.png
http://i.imgur.com/4LQjAjT.png
http://i.imgur.com/C7gN7rB.png
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6-8H7VfNh5I [/spoiler] [img]http://ardetus.com/devpics/theteam.png[/img] [b]Songoty[/b] - Project Manager / Lead Developer [b]Michael[/b] - Project Manager / Community Manager Halflive9 - Content Developer [url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=697625][B]Lootshare[/B][/url] - Content Developer Chk - Content Developer [img]http://ardetus.com/devpics/idevs.png[/img] We are currently looking for [B]1[/B] more world server content developer. This is not a paid position. You will not be required to put up any of your own money at any point during Ardetus as I pay for everything myself. [I]There are a few requirements,[/I]
[ul][*]A willingness to learn. You don't have to worry about the client side of things. You would be learning how my world engine works, and how to write content plugins for it. Plugins are provided through jar files and are easy to write but it will take you a bit of time to learn all the different aspects of the world. [*]A mature mentality. I'm not in high-school and therefore want to avoid any 'drama' that comes with that. You need a mature mindset. I give out constructive criticism, you must be able to take that at face value and not as a personal attack. I am a fair individual. [*]An understanding of Java. My world engine is nothing like winterLove based frameworks. I will help you understand the best I can but you should be able to understand through the documentation as well as the code itself. You also need to be able to write clean, clear, simple code. I'm not a fan of over complicated code especially when it is not necessary. [*]Experience using git is preferred but if you have never used git before don't worry about it, I will help you. [*]An IDE is preferred but if that doesn't work for you then so be it. I'm not going to tell you what tools you should use to develop.[/ul]
Basically what it boils down to is we're not looking for show-off-ee individuals with a lack of programming capability, instead looking for people wanting to learn and wanting to be a part of a project with a more experienced person. If you think you meet the requirements go ahead and send me a private message titled 'Ardetus Position' about yourself. Don't embellish. Be yourself, Inshallah.
[img]http://ardetus.com/devpics/qcc.png[/img] Please feel free to post any questions comments or concerns in this thread and I will try to respond to all of them. I look forward to hearing from you.

item.title: Ardetus
item.dc:creator: @Ardetus Ardetus
item.description:
@Ardetus wrote:

Part of our next dev blog -

[SIZE=3]New Team Members[/SIZE] We've recruited two new world server content developers to the team! The ball of motivation and completed tasks on the Ardetus project continues to roll as we welcome [url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=697625][B]Lootshare[/B][/url] & [B]Chk[/B] to the team! We now have three extra content developers on our team; in the weeks ahead, we will be very excited to share with the community the content they're working on.

Read full topic

item.title: Ardetus
item.dc:creator: @Ardetus Ardetus
item.description:
@Ardetus wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:13, topic:555001”][quote author=Ardetus link=topic=673927.msg4506653#msg4506653 date=1459877055]

The website is pretty shoddy looking and doesn’t fit the theme of an MMORPG, are there any plans to improve that?

It’s a basic vbulletin forum and portal system to share with the community our dev blogs.
It’s one of our favorite simple & blue themes.

Why vbulletin when there are better alternatives for FREE that offer further security?

What’re some examples? Maybe we’ll check them out.
We started with MyBB but transferred over to a vB copy as we had a spare license around.
It’s really what’s familiar to us, and it is plenty secure.
We’ve tried PhpBB and SMF, they’re good, don’t get me wrong, but vB imo is the best out of the three.
[/quote]

Explain to me why vbulletin beats SMF? SMF is more secure, free, offers everything vbulletin offers at an increased speed and paired with the SSI.php it literally blows vbulletin out of the water.

As for vbulletin being “plenty secure”, you do realise that you’re using a version that’s 6 years out of date? In 3.8.4 alone there are registration bypasses, a whole tonne of XSS vulnerabilities, high severity object injections to name but a few.

MyBB is similar to vbulletin but more up-to-date, enhanced security and offers a PHP integrator class by PHPDave (outdated, but works securely). I literally beg you not to use the absolute mess that is vbulletin.[/quote]

Thanks for the post, we’ll look around and consider our options.
For now we’ve patched the exploits listed and for the duration of the alpha development phase we’ll stick with vB.

[SIZE=4]Latest Dev Blog[/size]

[SIZE=3]New Team Members[/SIZE] We've recruited a new content developer this week, happily welcoming [B]Halflive9[/B] to the Ardetus team! In the weeks ahead, while the client is still being actively developed, he will be writing content on the world server in preparation for the open-alpha release.

[SIZE=3]Updates[/SIZE]
Equipment and inventory save

Functional right click menus

Social lists

[SIZE=3]Planned Content[/SIZE]
[B]Home[/B] - Entrana
http://ardetus.com/devpics/entrana1.png
We want to make the starting area & home teleport originally take you to Entrana.
With fast travel NPCs in the large cities, it won’t be hard to get to anywhere else in the world from there.
Also with the ability to set your home teleport to any favorite city of your choice, it can be changed if you don’t enjoy it.

[SIZE=3]World engine stability[/SIZE]
The closed-alpha world server has been running for more than three weeks consistently on our VPS without running into any errors or having to restart for any reason other than updates.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Ardetus, post:11, topic:555001”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=673927.msg4506644#msg4506644 date=1459859299]

The website is pretty shoddy looking and doesn’t fit the theme of an MMORPG, are there any plans to improve that?

It’s a basic vbulletin forum and portal system to share with the community our dev blogs.
It’s one of our favorite simple & blue themes.

Why vbulletin when there are better alternatives for FREE that offer further security?
[/quote]

What’re some examples? Maybe we’ll check them out.
We started with MyBB but transferred over to a vB copy as we had a spare license around.
It’s really what’s familiar to us, and it is plenty secure.
We’ve tried PhpBB and SMF, they’re good, don’t get me wrong, but vB imo is the best out of the three.[/quote]

Explain to me why vbulletin beats SMF? SMF is more secure, free, offers everything vbulletin offers at an increased speed and paired with the SSI.php it literally blows vbulletin out of the water.

As for vbulletin being “plenty secure”, you do realise that you’re using a version that’s 6 years out of date? In 3.8.4 alone there are registration bypasses, a whole tonne of XSS vulnerabilities, high severity object injections to name but a few.

MyBB is similar to vbulletin but more up-to-date, enhanced security and offers a PHP integrator class by PHPDave (outdated, but works securely). I literally beg you not to use the absolute mess that is vbulletin.

Read full topic

item.title: Ardetus
item.dc:creator: @Ardetus Ardetus
item.description:
@Ardetus wrote:

Weekly dev blog

This week was a fairly productive week.

We got the resizable chatbox working

We started on the skill interface

We started on the equipment interface

And many more small features.

The week ahead I will be focusing on World Content. It will be nice to switch it up a bit and focus on a different aspect of Ardetus. This week however I will be away for a few days for my work, but I should be doing a bit of work while on the road!

I would like to complete the following this week

[ul][]Social Lists (Friends, Blocks, etc)
[]Woodcutting
[]Firemaking
[]A few areas[/ul]

That seems like a good goal and I’m sure I will be able to achieve it.

We would like to thank you, the user for being with us during the development phase, and we hope Ardetus will exceed your expectations for a server.

Read full topic

item.title: Ardetus
item.dc:creator: @Ardetus Ardetus
item.description:
@Ardetus wrote:

[center] Website | Incentive Rewards
[hr]

5IRKsXO.png700×1373


Keeping the Ardetus client up to date is a simple task.
Simply launch the loader and it will automatically check for archive, file, and client updates, and then update them immediately.
It will then launch the latest version of the client for you.


[spoiler]
Every piece of the user interface in this picture is using my component system.


[/spoiler]

Songoty - Project Manager / Lead Developer
Michael - Project Manager / Community Manager
Halflive9 - Content Developer
Lootshare - Content Developer
Chk - Content Developer

We are currently looking for 1 more world server content developer. This is not a paid position.
You will not be required to put up any of your own money at any point during Ardetus as I pay for everything myself.
There are a few requirements,

[ul][]A willingness to learn. You don’t have to worry about the client side of things. You would be learning how my world engine works, and how to write content plugins for it. Plugins are provided through jar files and are easy to write but it will take you a bit of time to learn all the different aspects of the world.
[]A mature mentality. I’m not in high-school and therefore want to avoid any ‘drama’ that comes with that. You need a mature mindset. I give out constructive criticism, you must be able to take that at face value and not as a personal attack. I am a fair individual.
[]An understanding of Java. My world engine is nothing like winterLove based frameworks. I will help you understand the best I can but you should be able to understand through the documentation as well as the code itself. You also need to be able to write clean, clear, simple code. I’m not a fan of over complicated code especially when it is not necessary.
[]Experience using git is preferred but if you have never used git before don’t worry about it, I will help you.
[*]An IDE is preferred but if that doesn’t work for you then so be it. I’m not going to tell you what tools you should use to develop.[/ul]

Basically what it boils down to is we’re not looking for show-off-ee individuals with a lack of programming capability, instead looking for people wanting to learn and wanting to be a part of a project with a more experienced person. If you think you meet the requirements go ahead and send me a private message titled ‘Ardetus Position’ about yourself. Don’t embellish. Be yourself, Inshallah.


Please feel free to post any questions comments or concerns in this thread and I will try to respond to all of them. I look forward to hearing from you.

Read full topic
